p.div: I am thrilled to welcome you to my corner of the web. I am a Ph. D. candidate at the Department of Business Economics and Public Policy, Kelley School of Business, Indiana University.

I am an applied economist with an interest broadly in empirical industrial organization, applied microeconomics, and antitrust. I am passionate about delving into the intricate behavior of firms in the marketplace — how they wield their market power, their behavioral nuances, and the intriguing dynamics of collusive behavior.

I employ a various spectrum of applied econometric, spatial, and policy evaluation methodologies, enhancing my empirical expertise by integrating technology-driven approaches including web-scraping, structural modeling, and predictive, as well as causal inference approaches.
For any questions about my research or other scholarly activities, please get in touch with me by email hgle@iu.edu. You can also reach me on Twitter @hong_lee_econ.
